l.m: 女娲造人自从盘古开辟了天地后，
l.e: Since Nuwa created man, since Pangu opened up the world,
There is a sun in the sky,
the moon and the stars;

l.m: 大地上也有了秀丽的山川、
l.e: There are also beautiful mountains and rivers on the earth,

l.m: 郁郁葱葱的草木和数不清的珍禽异兽。
到处都充满了勃勃生机。
神通广大的女神女娲来到天地间游历。
深邃的天空中日月星辰绽放着光辉，
广阔的大地上鸟兽鱼虫繁衍滋长。
这一切使她感到无比的喜悦。
l.e: All this brought her great joy.
while walking,

l.m: 女娲不知不觉地来到湖边。
l.e: Nuwa came to the lake without knowing it.

l.m: 她看到清澈见底的湖水中倒映着自己的面容和身影，
l.e: She saw her own face and figure reflected in the crystal clear lake water,
So he waved his hand,

l.m: 这时湖水中的影子也朝她挥了挥手；
l.e: At this time, the shadow in the lake also waved to her;
she laughs,
The shadows in the lake are also laughing;
She pretended to be angry,

l.m: 湖水中的影子也朝她生气。
l.e: The shadow in the lake was also angry at her.
Nüwa suddenly became thoughtful,

l.m: 她想这天地间各种各样的事物都有了，
l.e: She thinks that there are all kinds of things in this world,

l.m: 恰恰就没有像自己一样的生物，
l.e: It just so happens that there is no creature like myself,

l.m: 为何不造就一些像自己一样的生物加入到这天地间来呢？

l.e: Nuwa looked around,

l.m: 只见湖边有一望无际的黄土。
用双手捧起了一捧地上的黄土，
就着湖中的水在手中捏揉了许久，
然后照着自己的样子捏出了一个小东西。
l.e: Then pinched a little thing according to his own appearance.

l.m: 她把这个小东西放到地上。
l.e: She put the little thing on the ground.
It's amazing!
eloquent,
And also very clever.

l.m: 女娲对自己的这一创造感到十分满意。
l.e: Nuwa was very satisfied with her creation.

l.m: 她索性收集了很大一堆泥土，
l.e: She simply collected a large pile of soil,
Keep pinching up.
She kept pinching and pinching,

l.m: 一个个可爱的小东西就在她周围不停地跳着、
l.e: Cute little things kept dancing around her,
jumping,
cheering,
Nuwa also smiled happily.

l.m: 女娲给这些小东西起名叫做“人”。
l.e: Nuwa named these little things "people".

c.m: 这些小东西起名叫做“人”

l.m: 人就是能直立行走的意思。
l.e: Human means to be able to walk upright.
Nüwa wanted these to be wise,

l.m: 能言语的人遍布整个大地。
l.e: People who can speak are all over the earth.
She began pinching day and night.
Sleepy,

l.m: 把头枕在岩石上打个盹；

l.e: thirsty,

l.m: 她心里想的都是这些人。
但是毕竟这大地实在是太辽阔了，
她努力捏的人一旦分散到大地上后，
湖中两只水鸟为了争夺一条小鱼，
女娲摸着这凉爽的湖水，
从峭壁上拉下长长的老藤。
l.e: Pull down long old vines from cliffs.

l.m: 她把老藤的一端牢牢地捆在一块大石头上，
把泥土拌成黏稠的泥浆。

l.e: then,

l.m: 把这些泥浆糊在长长的老藤上，

c.m: 这些泥浆糊在长长的老藤上

e.g: The mud sticks to the long old vines

l.m: 同时把老藤的另一端紧紧地握在手里，
l.e: At the same time hold the other end of the old vine tightly in your hand,

l.m: 然后不停地甩动着手中的老藤。
l.e: Then he kept shaking the old vine in his hand.
It's amazing!

l.m: 溅起来的泥浆落到地上后，
l.e: After the splashed mud fell to the ground,

l.m: 居然成了一群群哇哇叫的小人。
l.e: It turned out to be a group of yelling villains.

l.m: 这个办法实在是省事多了。
l.e: This method is really much easier.
Nuwa was very happy.
Not long after,
The world is full of people.

l.m: 看着自己的杰作已布满了神州大地，
l.e: Seeing that his masterpieces have covered the land of China,
Nuwa thought to herself,
It's time for me to rest too.
then,

l.m: 她放下了劳作又开始去各处游历。
l.e: She put down her work and began to travel around.
But after a while,

l.m: 她发现自己创造的人不仅没有增多，
l.e: She found that the people she created not only did not increase,
And it is decreasing day by day.
What is the reason?
Later, Nvwa discovered that
People will grow old and die.

l.m: 自己最早创造的人开始一批批地死去了。
l.e: The first people created by themselves began to die in batches.
so,
She had to go back to her old job,

l.m: 又开始了制造人的劳作。
l.e: The work of making people began again.

l.m: 女娲周而复始地制造着人。
l.e: Nuwa creates people again and again.
over time,
She thinks this is too much trouble.

l.m: 怎样才能让人类绵延不绝地继续生存下去呢？
l.e: How can human beings continue to survive indefinitely?
Nu Wa fell into deep thought again...
finally,

l.m: 女娲想出了一个绝妙的办法：
l.e: Nuwa came up with a wonderful way:

l.m: 那就是把这些小人分成男的和女的，
l.e: That is to divide these villains into males and females,

c.m: 这些小人分成男的和女的

e.g: These villains are divided into male and female

l.m: 让男人和女人相互结合起来生儿育女，
l.e: Let men and women unite to produce children,

l.m: 让他们自己去延续后代。
l.e: Let them perpetuate their offspring.

e.g: They themselves go on to progeny

l.m: 人类便这样世世代代地繁衍下来了。
l.e: Human beings have been reproduced from generation to generation in this way.
